page.title: 16Station Road
page.content: {Station Road}was once a quiet road leading to the Maltings. Now it is a busy road, with much traffic. It is particularly busy in the mornings and evenings. There is a main line station to London and the north. Many commuters travel to work each day. There is a railway crossing, which releases a stream of traffic each day up the hill. Efforts have been made to have a controlled crossing but with no result. The school children have to cross Station Road but they have a crossing guide to help them. After the morning rush the traffic thins out to a stream of mainly,east coast traffic, chiefly continental lorries with exports and imports. At the crossroads the road narrows and there's a hill making it difficult to see on-coming traffic.
